timeline.bodyText: The name is a bit misleading. I initially thought that the query wouldn't set the content, but it does. Rename it to something like `INSERT_FILE_ATTRIBUTES_AND_CONTENT_WITHOUT_DIGEST.
timeline.author: nictas

timeline.bodyText: The name/signature of the method doesn't indicate in any way that the result will be the digest of the input stream.
timeline.author: nictas

timeline.bodyText: I'm not the biggest fan of this re-throw. The exceptions don't have anything to do with SQL, so it's a bit of a hack to wrap them in an SQLException. I'd be a bit more OK if the wrapper exception was an IllegalStateException.
timeline.author: nictas

timeline.bodyText: Is this in the same transaction and if not, can this be a problem? For example, having two people upload the same file in parallel. The first stores the content in the database successfully, but before updating the digest, the second person tries to retrieve the list of files to check whether he can skip the upload. He sees the file entry, tries to use the digest and fails with a nil pointer dereference, because it is nil.
timeline.author: nictas

replies.bodyText: You're right. It's currently not in a single transaction but I will change it to be.
replies.author: radito3

timeline.bodyText: What if some moron passes a non-integer here? Will this be handled gracefully by our exception handlers?
timeline.author: nictas
